summary: From a young age, I‚Äôve had an innate desire to help people. Whether it was identifying problems when no one else was looking, asking the probing questions that every parent dreads, or offering solutions‚Äîsometimes unsolicited‚ÄîI was always driven to make things better. If you had asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up, my answers would have included lawyer, police officer, or doctor. As I got older, I knew those weren't right for me. My career journey has taken me through various sectors, including small to medium-sized businesses, the service industry, a lobbying firm in Washington D.C., a mega-church, and local government. In each organization, I consistently sought to understand the challenges at hand. I asked questions, identified issues, and proposed solutions‚Äîsome welcomed, others less so. Regardless of the setting, my focus remained on finding the most strategic and logical paths forward. This involved refining existing processes and systems. One recurring theme across all these organizations was a lack of clarity in management and leadership. Employees often struggled with unclear expectations, resulting in low morale and plenty of ‚Äúwater cooler‚Äù conversations post-meetings. Furthermore, genuine people development was frequently overlooked. Through my diverse work experiences and education, I discovered the sweet spot where my skills and passions intersected. company: Fresno County Women's Chamber of Commerce
company_description: The Fresno County Women‚Äôs Chamber of Commerce was originally established as a committee within an organization. Women served on some committees but, were not allowed to hold office and did not have voting privileges. Because women were paid lower salaries in those days, most women could not afford to join the Greater Fresno Area Chamber of Commerce. In 1950, that all changed. Martha McKinley received permission from the President of the Chamber to form a ‚ÄúWomen‚Äôs Section‚Äù, with dues more affordable to the working women of that time. They were to have their own Officers and Bylaws. For the next 40 years, the Women‚Äôs Section acted as a support group for the Chamber. In 1990 it was time for a change and thus evolved the Fresno County Women‚Äôs Chamber of Commerce, a 501(c)(6) organization. Our mission is to provide and promote professional opportunities, personal development, financial growth, community leadership and legislative awareness for women. We believe in supporting each other and watching our members‚Äô successes. By encouraging others to do business with fellow members, members see their business and friendships grow. Inspiring you: To think differently To discover something new To meet new people To play a greater role in our community To discover new ways to help your business grow

summary: I am a leadership, Management, and Career developer because I know what it feels like not to have a good leader early in my career. I was surrounded by leaders in the wrong positions and people in positions of authority who had no business being there. I want to give people who are considering leadership, those in leadership who are struggling, and executives who are over their heads an opportunity to develop before they hurt someone or themselves. I want to see the day when workers do not have to go home and consume their dinner and talk about the underdeveloped and unprepared leaders they work for. Do you know the leader I am talking about or is that you? Ok, so here is all the other stuff people want to see: I am a Best-selling author of A Lion's Pride: The Scars That Silenced Kings, and I co-authored Voices for Leadership: Your Pathway to Becoming a More Influential Leader, The Latino Leadership Playbook, and Latinos 100. I have served as an Executive, Business Owner, Veteran & Advocate, Board Member, Non-Profit Administrator, Speaker, Mentor, Coach, and Avid Volunteer. Over the past 30 years, I have held numerous executive advisor and senior positions while serving in the United States Navy and civilian sector. Through education and training, I helped strengthen the chain of command and businesses, providing sound decision support and creating open communication at all levels. I also helped formulate and implement policies concerning morale, welfare, job satisfaction, discipline, and training of Navy and civilian personnel. My performance won me the Meritorious Service Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal. I was named 2013, 2014, and 2017 Mentor of the Year, and recipient of the inaugural 2014 Chief John Dungan Jr. Oceanographer of the Navy Award. I was also awarded The Arnold Fletcher Award and inducted into the SALUTE National honors society for my academic achievements. I volunteer actively for various projects and non-profits, earning the esteemed Bronze, Silver, and Gold President‚Äôs Volunteer Service Award. I host the Award-Winning Developing the Leader Within Podcast. On the DTLW Podcast, I share real-world leadership lessons shaped by my personal experiences, challenges, and victories. Having overcome significant obstacles, including 26 years of Naval service, I know what it takes to lead with resilience and authenticity. Tune in for insights on leadership, growth, thriving in adversity, and entrepreneurship, whether you're leading a team or just leading your life.

summary: If you are a CEO, entrepreneur or business owner pursuing mergers or acquisitions as part of your growth strategy, let‚Äôs talk. There‚Äôs a reason CEO's call me an "M&A Whisperer". headline: Unlocking Clarity & Impact Through Integrative Coaching
summary: Are you a leader, social entrepreneur, or creative professional feeling disconnected from your purpose, struggling to balance impact with personal well-being, or finding yourself stuck in old patterns? Do you find your team stuck in old patterns, rehashing past challenges instead of moving towards a more generative future? As a social entrepreneur, are you struggling to align your deep values with your daily actions, and find a clear path to making the impact you desire? At Heyman Partners, we understand these challenges. We help leaders, social entrepreneurs, and creative professionals move past these obstacles to achieve impact with joy through integrated growth and aligned purpose. We guide individuals and organizations to the sweet spot where they can make a real difference while maintaining a deep sense of fulfillment. I've worked with many leaders who, while managing people and resources, guiding strategy and implementation, and confronting disagreement, sometimes neglect their own internal boundaries, leading to overwhelm and burnout. I've also learned that while occasionally rehashing "war stories" can be instructive, focusing on those times can keep you and your team stuck in the past, rather than moving towards a generative future. In my work, I help my clients learn to develop healthy boundaries, shift away from trauma bonds, and move forward with generative energy. Here‚Äôs what some of my clients say: ‚ÄúI threw out a number of goals and within 20 minutes we had compelling and inspiring direction.‚Äù ‚ÄúShe has twice lead out team in decision making that enabled us to thrive and grow as an organization.‚Äù ‚ÄúShe could cut to the heart of an issue and help us find our way there, and also a path forward.‚Äù Are you or your team ready to discover your sweet spot where impact and joy intersect? We believe that clarity of purpose, quality of interaction, and aligned action can transform your work and life, leading to more sustainable and generative outcomes. If you are ready to bring joy and fulfillment back into your work, and align your values and actions for a greater impact, visit my website in my profile section to learn more about our integrative approach to growth and how we can help you find your sweet spot.

summary: As an Organizational Development Consultant, Professional Development Leader, and Executive Coach, Phil has led programs across HR, Operations, Talent, Enterprise, and IT groups, as well as helping C-Suite Executives realize their greatest potential. He has developed best practice consulting solutions, delivered customized training programs, and facilitated executive coaching sessions for global clients such as JP Morgan, Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, The Hartford, NASA, MIT Lincoln Labs, Pfizer/Pharmacia, Merck, Phillips Petroleum, Walmart, BCBS, Prudential, The Hanover, AT&T, Genzyme and many others. Frustration leads to doubt and a business suffers as a result. Our clients are the size companies that hire the majority of people and pay most of the taxes in this country. However, these companies do not have consistent access to professional cash flow management that would help them in a time of need. That is where Newpoint comes in. CASE STUDY: Often companies are sent to us when they are in significant trouble. Our job is to move quickly to give them visibility to the issues and come up with viable solutions. We have worked with hundreds of companies that faced game changing decisions, like one mid-west based machine shop. They had been around for years, but since economic turmoil and some personal matters came up, they had not been able to turn a profit. Their lender was fatigued, but not totally ready to give up. We were able to work with management over a two week period of time, put together a Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢ tool that showed where quick changes would solve the immediate issues. headline: Partner, ON Partners/ Head of People + Talent Practice
summary: I‚Äôm an applied anthropologist, executive coach, and reticulist, dedicated to transforming how organizations navigate talent management, leadership, and culture. For over 17 years, I‚Äôve partnered with CEOs, executive teams, and boards across venture capital, private equity, and Fortune 100 companies to align people strategies with business strategies, creating cultures that drive performance and innovation. As a C-suite Advisor on Talent, I specialize in helping leaders thrive amid uncertainty. My approach is rooted in understanding the complex interplay between people and organizations‚Äîdesigning strategies that not only meet immediate business needs but also foster long-term growth and resilience. I‚Äôve had the privilege of consulting for global organizations, including Nike, Amazon, McKinsey, and Microsoft, as well as scaling startups, guiding them through inflection points that required deep leadership transformation and organizational redesign. Leadership, in my view, is not just about the individual; it‚Äôs about the intersection of culture, strategy, and human dynamics. By aligning human capital strategy with business objectives, organizations can navigate complexity and achieve sustainable success. I believe that trust, agility, and strategic talent development are essential for any organization looking to thrive in today‚Äôs rapidly changing landscape. As a reticulist, I bring together diverse, often unlikely, groups of people to create innovative solutions to today‚Äôs most pressing challenges. By convening different perspectives, I believe we can drive breakthroughs that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible‚Äîwhether in business transformation, innovation, or addressing societal needs. I also serve as an Advisor for Transform, Sempervirens Venture Capital, and partnership with ON Partners. My board roles include the Advisory Board for The Mentor Project and the Board of Directors for AID International, a nonprofit empowering Haitian communities to achieve self-sustainability. I hold a master‚Äôs degree in Organizational Development from Pepperdine University, where I‚Äôm an Adjunct Professor in the MBA program, teaching Talent Management. I‚Äôm also a member of Marshall Goldsmith‚Äôs 100 Coaches, a premier community of industry thought leaders curated and led by Marshall Goldsmith . headline: Growing company value, exit planning, M&A advisory services, investor and board member
summary: With my background of owning companies for over 35-years as well as investing in and selling business I have owned I have learned great lessons as a CPA, CFO and CEO. This firm was created to leverage my prior experience to assist business owners as a long-term trusted advisor in the business financial arena. My passion is coaching business leaders to grow revenue, margin, profit, cash flow and ultimately the value of their companies. Whether this is for a 120-year-old multi-generational family legacy company or a startup with a great idea and in need of capital, I serve the gap between the owners, CEO and finance team. I have expertise in growing companies, preparing them for a sale transition and walking them through the process of the sale. I also provide guidance with obtaining capital and optimal debt structure. During my career I have worked with hundreds of business enterprises and provided counsel to buyers and sellers of companies to maximize the value and resulting after tax cash. My passion in working with business owners has been the culmination of preparing the business for sale and successfully transitioning the ownership, with the rewards optimized for the seller. Exit Planning strategy and M&A execution are also areas of my expertise. I bring my experience in board rooms as an active and engaged board member for a select group of companies.

company_description: Tompkins Cortland Community College is one of 30 community colleges and 64 campuses in the State University of New York system.
